p.s: Teacher: To say "The big man," we use the adjective "groß" and add e because "man" is masculine. So, it becomes "Der große Mann."
Teacher: Now, let's practice a few more examples using masculine nouns.
Teacher: How would you say, "The big man goes to the supermarket"?
Student: Der große Mann geht zum Supermarkt.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say, "The old man sits in the park"?
Student: Der alte Mann sitzt im Park.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: How would you say, "The strong father can't play football because he is tired"?
Student: Der starke Vater, kann nicht Fußball spielen, weil er müde ist
Teacher: Great job!
Teacher: How would you say, "The brave firefighter, rescues the cat from the tree"?
Student: Der tapfere Feuerwehrmann rettet die Katze vom Baum.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say, "The happy father walks in the park"?
Student: Der glückliche Vater, spaziert im Park.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: For female and neutral nouns, it's the same, just add an e
Teacher: For example, to say, "The beautiful woman," we use the adjective "schön" and add "-e" because "woman" is feminine. So, it becomes "Die schöne Frau."
Teacher: How would you say, "The beautiful woman smiles at the camera"?
Student: Die schöne Frau, lächelt in die Kamera.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: How would you say, "The intelligent daughter reads a book"?
Student: Die intelligente Tochter liest ein Buch.
Teacher: Great job!
Teacher: How would you say, "The friendly neighbor (female) invites us for dinner"?
Student: Die freundliche Nachbarin lädt uns zum Abendessen ein.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: How would you say "The small apartment is cozy"?
Student: Die kleine Wohnung ist gemütlich.
Teacher: Great job!
Teacher: How would you say, "The nice teacher (female) explains the lesson"?
Student: Die nette Lehrerin erklärt die Lektion.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say, "The small child plays in the park"?
Student: Das kleine Kind spielt im Park.
Teacher: Good job!
Teacher: How would you say, "The fancy car drives fast"?
Student: Das schicke Auto fährt schnell.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say, "The clean room smells fresh"?
Student: Das saubere Zimmer riecht frisch.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: How would you say, "The new book is interesting"?
Student: Das neue Buch ist interessant.
Teacher: Good!
Teacher: How would you say, "The big house has a bathroom"?
Student: Das große Haus hat ein Badezimmer.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say, "The hot drink warms us up"?
Student: Das heiße Getränk wärmt uns auf.
Teacher: Great job!
Teacher: Excellent work with the adjective endings in the nominative case! Keep practicing to reinforce your understanding. Well done!
